creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Let's start with the basics.

  1. Do you have three entries in the outgoing servers(smtp) in account settings?
  2. Is a different outgoing server (SMTP) set in the identity of each account. (the entry above server settings in the list)
  3. Does each outgoing server(SMTP) have it's own unique user name and password for the address it is used to send from? (Historically SMTP servers would be shared with the outcome you suggest you need one for each account)
  4. Are you using alias addresses in hotmail/outlook? They simply replace the information Thunderbird submits with the name etc they have online for the primary account when mail is submitted using SMTP.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: right click the folder and select properties and ensure it is selected for synchronization when checking mail. junk and trash are not and others may not be depending in the server implementation.

content:
Matt said
often when programs on your computer update the antivirus (or it's software firewall) block access to the internet. Given that Thunderbird is in an update cycle I am guessing it is quite probably what has happened to you.

i've never had this happen on an update. i use thunderbird for my optimum mail acct and i have AVG protection software. how do i rectify the problem of my mail not loading. all my folders are in tact and i know i have new mail because i can see it on the optimum site.
